availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Davis C. Glore (Boone County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. )

body.p: Boone County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Glore. Father of Maria Glore, J. W. Glore, Melton Glore, Nancy S. Glore, Martha J. Glore, John K. Glore, and Davis C. Glore Jr. Farmer in Boone County, Kentucky in 1863. Served in the 55th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from October 18, 1864 to September 19, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District 2, p. 164A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, Big Bone, p. 153A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Boone County, KY, June-July1863, p. 90 (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0465.
